page.title: 03 Roads
page.content:
The main{A342}road cuts the block almost on its diagonal and connects {Andover}with{Ludgershall.} Much money has been spent on new and improved roads to cope with more and more cars and lorries. Many families now have two cars and the development of the motor vehicle in this century has caused more alteration to the countryside than anything in the nine hundred years since the original {Domesday.}
Much money is spent on maintaining roads, providing road signs, and on white lines to try to make driving safer. Yet every year many hundreds of people are killed and injured. Owners have to leave their cars in their own private garages or on the roads if they have no room on their own property.
